page.title: 12NAYLOR BROS. CLAY PIPES.
page.content: Naylor Bros. was founded in 1840.It began as an engineering contractors and then developed into a clay pipe unit in 1890.The discovery of the clay on the site began when the building of the{Denby Dale Viaduct} in Yorkshire. Naylors got their first tunnel kiln in 1962 and the second in 1967.Naylors pipes are mostly used for sewage treatment.The Naylor group has grown over the years. Clay pipes have been used for over 3000 years.They are used for drains and sewers.A 1200 year old clay pipe was recently discovered in Mecca,Saudi-Arabia. The raw materials are put on a turn table that produces the shape of the pipes.It is then put into a fire clay kiln.The kiln is capable of producing 1500m of pipe an hour.Then they are put into a tunnel kiln to be fired.
